alert.note: Alert for Cherokee; Clay (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 10 at 5:37AM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...STRONG THUNDERSTORMS WILL IMPACT CHEROKEE...CLAY...SOUTHEASTERN POLK AND SOUTHEASTERN MONROE COUNTIES THROUGH 630 AM EDT... At 536 AM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 6 miles south of Madisonville to 10 miles west of Ducktown. Movement was east at 60 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 45 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Andrews, Murphy, Ducktown, Hayesville, Nantahala Lake, Tellico Plains, William L. Davenport Refuge, Tusquitee, Coker Creek, and Violet. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
